hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ gave him a nickname while he was a boy.

chainIssues: Jabir ibn Yazid al-Ju'fi is classified as Da'if (weak) by hadith scholars and is known for tadlis
Unknown narrator (رَجُلٍ) with majhul status creates a disconnection in the chain
Transmission from al-Ju'fi to the unknown man uses عَنْ which is indirect
Overall chain reliability severely compromised by weak narrators and unknown figures

potential_issues.issue: Jabir ibn Yazid al-Ju'fi is a Da'if (weak) narrator known for tadlis
potential_issues.impact: This is a critical issue as Jabir al-Ju'fi was criticized by hadith scholars including Ibn Ma'in, Ahmad, and al-Bukhari for being a weak and unreliable narrator

potential_issues.issue: Unknown narrator (رَجُلٍ) in the chain
potential_issues.impact: An unnamed person appearing in the chain creates a major disconnection and makes the entire chain unreliable

potential_issues.issue: Sufyan ibn Uyaynah uses indirect transmission term (عَنْ) with Jabir
potential_issues.impact: While Sufyan is reliable, his use of عَنْ with a weak narrator like Jabir compounds the reliability issues

Topics: Prophet's ﷺ naming of young Anas ibn Malik
Incident of the Prophet ﷺ giving nickname to companion

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came to us when I was ten years old, and he died when I was twenty years old. My mothers urged me to serve him. One day he entered our house and we milked a domestic goat for him, and he drank water from the well in the house, with Abu Bakr on his left and a Bedouin on his right, and Umar beside him. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ drank, and Umar said: Give it to Abu Bakr, O Messenger of Allah. But he gave it to the Bedouin, and said: The right one, then the right one.

chainIssues: Al-Zuhri (Ibn Shihab) is known as a mudallis by various hadith scholars including Ibn Hajar
Al-Zuhri uses عَنِ with Anas ibn Malik, which combined with his mudallis status should be noted
However, al-Zuhri is widely accepted by the majority of hadith scholars as reliable and trustworthy
The transmission term سَمِعَ from al-Zuhri suggests direct hearing from Anas

potential_issues.issue: Al-Zuhri (Ibn Shihab) is classified as a mudallis by some scholars
potential_issues.impact: While al-Zuhri is generally reliable and accepted by the majority of hadith scholars, his mudallis status should be noted. However, this does not significantly affect the chain's reliability given his overall reputation

potential_issues.issue: The transmission term عَنِ is used by Sufyan from al-Zuhri
potential_issues.impact: While al-Zuhri is reliable, the indirect term عَنِ maintains some ambiguity, though this is common with al-Zuhri and generally accepted

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: I did not see a night except that I saw my beloved (the Prophet ﷺ) in it, and then he wept.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: I have not seen anyone whose prayer resembles the prayer of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ more than the son of Umm Sulaym, meaning Anas ibn Malik.

potential_issues.issue: Thabit uses أَنَّ with Abu Hurairah instead of direct transmission term
potential_issues.impact: While أَنَّ can indicate indirect transmission, Thabit was a reliable narrator and his reports are generally accepted

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas: When Anas narrated from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, he would say: Or as the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: When he was narrating a hadith from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, a man asked him: Did you hear it directly from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? Anas became very angry and said: By Allah, not everything we narrate to you have we heard from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, but we do not suspect one another.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: I came to Madinah when Abu Bakr had died and Umar had been appointed Caliph. So I said to Umar: Raise your hand so I may pledge allegiance to you upon that upon which I pledged allegiance to your predecessor, upon hearing and obedience to the extent I am able.

hadiths.english_translation: The garden keeper of Anas ibn Malik complained to him about thirst in his land. Anas prayed and made supplication, and a cloud arose until it covered his land and filled his cistern. He sent his slave and said: Look where this water has reached. The slave looked and found that it did not exceed his land.

Topics: Incident of Anas ibn Malik's garden experiencing drought

Miraculous rain limited to Anas's land
The blessing of righteous servants' supplications

hadiths.english_translation: The gardener of Anas ibn Malik came to him in summer complaining of thirst. Anas called for water, performed ablution and prayed, then asked: Do you see anything? He said: I see nothing. Anas entered again and prayed, then in the third or fourth time said: Look. He said: I see something like the wing of a bird from the clouds. Then he continued to pray and supplicate until the gardener came to him and said: The sky has filled with clouds and it is raining. He said: Mount the horse that Bishr ibn Shaghaaf sent, and look where the rain has reached. The gardener rode and looked and found that the rain did not go beyond the houses of the al-Musayyin and did not reach the house of al-Ghadban.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ghalib: I have not seen anyone who was more guarded with his speech than Anas ibn Malik.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: A servant is not truly God-fearing until he is grieved from his tongue (meaning he grieves over his speech). Also reported: Anas entered the state of ihram from Dhat Irq and we did not hear him speak except in the remembrance of Allah until he exited ihram. Someone said to him: O cousin, this is how ihram should be done.

hadiths.english_translation: The sons of Anas ibn Malik said to their father: O father, why do you not narrate to us as you narrate to strangers? He said: O my sons, whoever speaks abundantly will be liable to error.

hadiths.english_translation: Anas ibn Malik said: By Allah, you are more beloved to me than an equal number from the children of Anas, except if they were like you in virtue. Also: Anas ibn Malik wrote Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah on his ring. When he entered the toilet, he would remove it. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik enter upon Al-Hajjaj wearing a black turban and having dyed his beard yellow. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a yellow loincloth and resting one of his feet upon the other. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a silk garment, a silk turban, and a silk robe. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a yellow silk garment - I have never seen a cloth more beautiful than it. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a robe from Yemen and a turban. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a black turban. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik dyeing his beard with yellow.

hadiths.english_translation: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a silk turban, a silk robe, and a silk garment. They said to him: Why do you forbid us from silk, yet you wear it yourself? He said: Because our governors clothe us in it, and we love for them to see it on us. Also: I saw Anas what you call silk in yellow and red colors. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a green silk garment with a mark. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a saffron-dyed loincloth. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing two saffron-dyed garments.

hadiths.english_translation: I saw the sleeve of Anas ibn Malik and its width was the size of his mouth, which is the size of the forearm. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a black turban without a skullcap, and he had extended it from the back. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik wearing a white skullcap. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik dyeing his beard with yellow. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik and his dye is red. Also: I saw Anas ibn Malik red-bearded and wearing a turban, having extended it from the back. Also: That Anas ibn Malik in the year in which he died could not fast, so he fed thirty poor people bread and meat, and additional food bowls or two bowls. Also: I asked Amr ibn Anas: What happened to Anas, what did he do? He said: He became weak for fasting a year before his death. He prepared food bowls and fed a poor person for each day. So he fed the required number and more.

hadiths.english_translation: When Anas ibn Malik died, Muhammad ibn Sirin was imprisoned due to a debt against him. Anas had requested that Muhammad wash his body. So they spoke to Umar ibn Yazid regarding him, who interceded for him, and he was released from prison. He washed his body, then returned to the prison until he went back into it. Muhammad ibn Sirin never ceased being grateful for this favor to the family of Umar ibn Yazid until he died.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Ansari
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Muhammad al-Ansari al-Basri

Topics: Incident of Anas ibn Malik's death
Anas's request for Muhammad ibn Sirin to wash his body
Muhammad ibn Sirin's imprisonment for debt
Umar ibn Yazid's intercession for Muhammad ibn Sirin
Expression of gratitude and loyalty between the righteous

hadiths.english_translation: When Anas ibn Malik died, he requested: Let Muhammad ibn Sirin wash him and pray over him. Muhammad was imprisoned, so they went to the governor, who was a man from Banu Umayyad, and he gave him permission. He came out and washed him, shrouded him, and prayed over him in the palace of Anas at al-Tiff, then returned and entered the prison as he was without going to his family. Also: Perfume was placed in his shrouding perfume containing musk, hair from the hair of the Prophet ﷺ, and in it was sugar. Muhammad ibn Sa'd said: I asked Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Ansari, the judge: At what age was Anas ibn Malik when he died? He said: At the age of one hundred and seven years.

hadiths.english_translation: Anas ibn Malik died in Basra in the year 92 AH, during the caliphate of Al-Walid ibn Abd al-Malik.

hadiths.english_translation: Anas ibn Malik was the last of the Prophet's ﷺ companions to die in Basra. Anas ibn Malik died in the year 93 AH.

Topics: Genealogy of Hisham ibn Amir
Khazraj tribe lineage

hadiths.english_translation: His mother was from Bahraa tribe. His father witnessed Badr and Uhud and was killed as a martyr on that day. Hisham accompanied the Prophet ﷺ and narrated from him. He settled in Basra and died there without offspring.

narrators.name: Narrator
narrators.full_name: Unknown

chainIssues: No transmission chain present

potential_issues.issue: Biographical information only
potential_issues.impact: This is biographical information without a hadith chain

His father's martyrdom at Uhud
His settlement in Basra

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Hisham ibn Amir: He came to the Prophet ﷺ. The Prophet ﷺ said: What is your name? He said: I am Shihab. The Prophet ﷺ said: Rather, you are Hisham.

Topics: The Prophet's ﷺ naming of Hisham ibn Amir
Incident of renaming a companion

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Hisham ibn Amir: You pass over me to a group of the Prophet's ﷺ companions who were not more attached to the Prophet ﷺ or more preserving of his speech than me. I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: There is no tribulation between the creation of Adam and the establishment of the Hour greater than the Antichrist.

Topics: Hisham ibn Amir's status among companions
Tribulation greater than the Antichrist
Signs of the Hour mentioned by the Prophet ﷺ

hadiths.english_translation: People from the tribe would pass over Hisham ibn Amir to seek Imran ibn al-Husayn and other companions of the Prophet ﷺ. Hisham said: You are passing over me to people who were not more present with the Prophet ﷺ, nor more retentive of his speech than me. I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: There is no tribulation from the creation of Adam until the establishment of the Hour greater than the Antichrist.
